messages.title: CAMERON: “GET WALES WORKING”
messages.content: David Cameron has spelled out what a Conservative government will do to get Wales working again, after the deepest and longest recession since the Second World War.

messages.title: STANDING UP FOR SWANSEA
messages.content: Conservatives want to see new jobs and new opportunities created for everyone.

messages.title: CONSERVATIVES: A FAIR DEAL FOR FAMILIES
messages.content: A Conservative Government will make Britain one of the most family friendly countries in the world.

messages.title: RENE FIGHTS FOR SWANSEA AGAINST COUNCIL WASTE
messages.content: Local Councillor and Conservative nominee for Swansea West next May, René Kinzett, is pledged to fight against council waste.

messages.title: STOP PAY BONANZA FOR COUNCILLORS
messages.content: René Kinzett has called on the Leader of Swansea City to reject 'scandalous' £800,000 pay hike and instead use the Local Government Candidate Kinzett has urged the Leader of the Liberal/Tory pact to apply the same criticism to refuse fat cat pay deals which would see senior councillors paid £54,000 on basic salary.

messages.title: CAMERON: “CUT THE DEFICIT, NOT THE NHS”
messages.content: David Cameron is committed to protecting the NHS and our schools during the recession.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Creating 10,000 Apprenticeships and 30,000 private sector jobs each year to boost the economy and provide opportunities for young people.
Simplify the tax system and remove tax credits complexity, ensuring millions pay no future income tax.
Supporting discipline in the classroom, improve teacher standards and reducing local council bureaucracy in education.
Increase Patient Choice and protect frontline services from wasteful government spending.
Fight against council waste and work to ensure budgets are spent efficiently.

issues.economy: Promote private sector job growth and provide apprenticeships.
issues.education: Improve discipline in classrooms, empower teachers, and reduce local council bureaucracy.
issues.governance: Work to stop pay increases for senior council members and reduce unnecessary council spending.
issues.health: Protect the NHS from government waste and increase patient choice.

quotes.text: CAMERON: “CUT THE DEFICIT, NOT THE NHS”

images.caption: David Cameron and René Kinzett with constituents.
